text: Can we cross post this publicly to <https://discourse.julialang.org|Discourse> for further visibility? React with :bridge: on the message above to approve. <https://github.com/JuliaCommunity/SlackBridge/blob/main/README.md#faq|More info here>
<https://hyphaebeast.club/writing/julia-web-scraping/|This> suggests using XML parsers. You'd suggest Gumbo.jl over those?

elements.text: suggests using XML parsers. You'd suggest Gumbo.jl over those?

text: Gumbo.jl doesn't look like it has a query api. It wouldn't be much effort to iterate over the tree and then break when I've found something-- write my own query api-- but that seems... sloppy?

elements.text: Gumbo.jl doesn't look like it has a query api. It wouldn't be much effort to iterate over the tree and then break when I've found something-- write my own query api-- but that seems... sloppy?

text: If you stand behind the endorsement, though, I'll take your word for it :ok_hand:.

elements.text: If you stand behind the endorsement, though, I'll take your word for it

text:
what do you mean by query? You use selector:
<https://github.com/Algocircle/Cascadia.jl>

text: since Gumbo is written in C by Google and Cscadia looks like a high quality Julia pkg, I would hope the combo is fast

elements.text: since Gumbo is written in C by Google and Cscadia looks like a high quality Julia pkg, I would hope the combo is fast

text: I came here to say Gumbo+Cascadia as well.

elements.text: I came here to say Gumbo+Cascadia as well.

text: Don't use an XML parser. It'll lead to pain.

<https://github.com/lexborisov/myhtml>

this seems to be fast (10x Gumbo), wish list of someone makes a binding

text: not sure, myhtml looked small and clean, but if Lexbor is what they recommend (it's very nice that it's still in pure C) then I guess we can go with that

text: last time I checked, some benchmark showed myhtml to be 10x faster than Gumbo (with built-in threading)
